{{Infobox person | name = Hugh Hefner | image = Hugh_Hefner_Glamourcon_2010.jpg | image_size = | caption = Hugh Hefner attending Glamourcon #50, Long Beach, CA on November 13, 2010 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1926|4|9}} | birth_name = Hugh Marston Hefner | birth_place = Chicago, Illinois, US | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | residence = [[Playboy Mansion]], [[Los Angeles]] | home_town = [[Hollywood, California]] | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] | education = [[Steinmetz High School]] | alma_mater = [[University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign|University of Illinois]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]])
[[Northwestern University]] | known for = [[Editing|Editor-in-chief]] of ''[[Playboy]]'' magazine, [[Chief Creative Officer]] of [[Playboy Enterprises]] | website = [http://www.playboy.com/ Playboy.com] | spouse = {{marriage|Mildred Williams|1949|1959}} (divorced),
{{marriage|[[Kimberley Conrad]]|1989|2009}}(divorced) | partner = [[Barbi Benton]] (1969-1976),
[[Brande Roderick]] (2000-2001),
[[Tina Marie Jordan]] (2001-2002),
[[Holly Madison]] (2003-2008),
[[Crystal Harris]] (2009â2011) | children = [[Christie Hefner]] (born 1952)
David Hefner (born 1955)
Marston Hefner (born 1990)
Cooper Hefner (born 1991) }} '''Hugh Marston "Hef" Hefner''' (born April 9, 1926) is an American magazine publisher, founder and [[Chief Creative Officer]] of [[Playboy Enterprises]].[http://www.playboyenterprises.com/home/content.cfm?content=t_officers&ArtTypeID=CorpOfficers&MmenuFlag=profile&SmenuFlag=sub_corp_profile_officers_o Corporate Officers]. Playboy Enterprises, Inc. ==Early life== Hefner was born in Chicago, Illinois, the elder of two sons born to Grace Caroline (nÃ©e Swanson; 1895â1997) and Glenn Lucius Hefner (1896â1976), both teachers.[http://books.google.com/books?id=m5b_eM3twmEC&pg=PT22&lpg=PT22#v=onepage&q=&f=false "Mr Playboy: Hugh Hefner and the American Dream"]. Steven Watts. Google Books. Retrieved October 10, 2009.Algis Valiunas, [http://www.commentarymagazine.com/viewarticle.cfm/the-playboy-and-his-western-world-15430 "The Playboy and His Western World"]. May 2010. Hefner's mother was of Swedish descent and his father had German and English ancestry.{{cite news|last=Mullen|first=William|title=Hef|work=Spokane Chronicle|date=August 8, 1984|url=http://news.google.ca/newspapers?id=MMUSAAAAIBAJ&sjid=qPkDAAAAIBAJ&pg=5884,1491659&dq=william-mullen&hl=en|accessdate=July 23, 2010}}{{cite news|last=Roberts|first=Gary Boyd|coauthors=|title=#58 Royal Descents, Notable Kin, and Printed Sources|pages=|publisher=New England Ancestors|date=|url=http://www.newenglandancestors.org/research/services/articles_gbr58.asp|accessdate=July 23, 2010}} On his father's side, Hefner is a direct descendant of Plymouth governor [[William Bradford (Plymouth governor)|William Bradford]].{{cite news| url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1112823,00.html | work=Time | title=Mr. Playboy: Hugh Hefner tells how he created an identity in order to fulfill his dreams | date=October 2, 2005}}{{cite news | url = http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/latimes/access/38763405.html?dids=38763405:38763405&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Feb+05%2C+1999&author=MICHAEL+QUINTANILLA&pub=Los+Angeles+Times&desc=STYLEMAKER+%2F+Hugh+Hefner.+The+king+of+swingers+reenters+the+singles+scene.%3B+Pajama+Party&pqatl=google | first=Michael | last=Quintanilla | title=STYLEMAKER / Hugh Hefner. The king of swingers reenters the singles scene.; Pajama Party | date=February 5, 1999}} He has described his family as "conservative, Midwest, Methodist."[http://jezebel.com/5594680/hugh-hefner-on-his-role-in-fighting-segregation Hugh Hefner On His Role In Fighting Segregation] He went to Sayre Elementary School and [[Steinmetz High School]], then served as a writer for a military newspaper in the U.S. Army from 1944 to 1946. He later graduated from the [[University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign]] with a [[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]] in [[psychology]] with a double [[academic minor|minor]] in [[creative writing]] and [[art]] in 1949, earning his degree in two and a half years. Hugh was a member of Delta Chi Fraternity. After graduation, he took a semester of graduate courses in [[sociology]] at [[Northwestern University]] but dropped out soon after.[http://www.playboyenterprises.com/home/content.cfm?content=t_template&packet=00061D22-C172-1C7A-9B578304E50A011A&MmenuFlag=profile Hugh M. Hefner] [[Playboy Enterprises]]. Retrieved January 2, 2009. ==Career== Working as a [[copywriter]] for ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]'', he left in January 1952, after being denied a $5 raise. In 1953, he mortgaged his furniture, generating a bank loan of $600 (or $800âhe cannot recall which) and raised $8,000 from 45 investorsâincluding $1,000 from his mother ("Not because she believed in the venture," he told ''[[E!]]'' in 2006, "But because she believed in her son.")âto launch ''[[Playboy]]'', which was initially going to be called ''Stag Party''. The undated first issue, published in December 1953, featured [[Marilyn Monroe]] from her 1949 nude calendar shoot and sold over 50,000 copies.http://entrepreneurs.about.com/od/famousentrepreneurs/p/hughhefner.htm (Hefner, who never met Monroe, bought the [[crypt]] next to hers at the [[Westwood Village Memorial Park Cemetery]].{{cite news | url = http://www.nytimes.com/2011/02/06/magazine/06Hefner-t.html | title = How Hef Got His Groove Back | date = February 3, 2011 | author = Charles McGrath | work = [[The New York Times]] }}[http://www.seeing-stars.com/Buried2/PierceBros5.shtml Westwood Village Memorial Cemetery]. Seeing-Stars.com.) After it was rejected by ''Esquire'' magazine in 1955, Hefner agreed to publish in ''Playboy'' the [[Charles Beaumont]] science fiction short story, "The Crooked Man," about straight men being persecuted in a world where homosexuality was the norm. After receiving angry letters to the magazine, Hefner wrote a response to criticism where he said, "If it was wrong to persecute heterosexuals in a homosexual society then the reverse was wrong, too." Hefner is portrayed as a gay rights pioneer in the documentary film, ''[[Hugh Hefner: Playboy, Activist and Rebel]]''.Garcia, Michelle. [http://www.advocate.com/News/Daily_News/2009/08/28/Hugh_Hefner,_Gay_Rights_Pioneer/ "Hugh Hefner, Gay Rights Pioneer"]. Advocate.com. August 28, 2009. On June 4, 1963, Hefner was arrested for selling obscene literature after an issue of ''Playboy'' featuring nude shots of [[Jayne Mansfield]] was released.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} A jury was unable to reach a verdict.[http://www.biography.com/articles/Hugh-Hefner-9333521?part=1 Hugh Hefner Biography]. biography.com. His former secretary, Bobbie Arnstein, was found dead in a Chicago hotel room after an overdose of drugs in January 1975. Hefner called a press conference to allege that she had been driven to suicide by narcotics agents and federal officers. Hefner further claimed the government was out to get him because of ''Playboy''{{'s}} philosophy and its advocacy of more liberal drug laws.{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/2008/oct/02/entertainment/et-book2 |title=The life and times of an alpha male |accessdate=January 17, 2009 |author=David Cotner |work = [[Los Angeles Times]] |date=October 2, 2008}}{{cite news |url=http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/19921023/REVIEWS/210230302/1023 |title=Hugh Hefner: Once upon a time |accessdate=January 17, 2009 |author=Roger Ebert |work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]] |date=October 23, 1992 }} In 2009, Hefner talks about making a film about his life.{{cite web |url=http://www.buddytv.com/articles/the-girls-next-door/the-girls-next-door-hef-ready-25741.aspx |title=Hef Ready for the big screen? |accessdate=January 17, 2009 |author= |publisher=BuddyTV |date=January 16, 2009 }} He has a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] for television and has made several movie appearances as himself. In 2010, he received a "worst supporting actor" nomination for a [[Razzie]] award for his performance in ''[[Miss March]]''. A documentary by Brigitte Berman, [[Hugh Hefner: Playboy, Activist and Rebel]] was released on July 30, 2010. He had previously granted full access to documentary filmmaker and television producer [[Kevin Burns]] for the A&E Biography special, [[Hugh Hefner: American Playboy]] in 1996.[http://www.hughhefnerplayboyactivistrebel.com/ Hugh Hefner: Playboy, Activist and Rebel] Hefner and Burns later collaborated on numerous other television projects, most notably on [[The Girls Next Door]], a reality series that ran for six seasons (2005-2009) and 90 episodes. In 1999, Hefner financed the [[Clara Bow]]-documentary, ''Discovering the It-girl.'' "Nobody has what Clara had. She defined an era and made her mark on the nation," he stated.Variety, June 7, 1999 ==Personal life== Hefner married Northwestern University student Mildred Williams (born March 10, 1926) in 1949. They had two children, [[Christie Hefner|Christie]] (born November 8, 1952) and David (born August 30, 1955).[http://www.playboy.com/worldofplayboy/hmh/timeline/pre50s-content.html Playboy Time Line] Before the wedding, Mildred confessed that she had had an affair while he was away in the Army. He called the admission "the most devastating moment of my life." A 2006 ''[[E! True Hollywood Story]]'' profile of Hefner revealed that Mildred allowed him to sleep with other women, out of guilt for her infidelity and in the hopes that it would preserve their marriage. They divorced in 1959.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}} Hefner remade himself as a [[bon vivant]] and [[Promiscuity|man about town]], a lifestyle he promoted in his magazine and two TV shows he hosted, ''[[Playboy's Penthouse]]'' (1959â1960) and ''[[Playboy After Dark]]'' (1969â1970). He admitted to being {{" '}}involved' with maybe eleven out of twelve months' worth of Playmates" during some of these years.[http://www.newyorker.com/critics/content/articles/060320crbo_books NewYorker.com], Acocella, Joan. "The Girls Next Door." ''[[The New Yorker]]'', March 20, 2006 [[Donna Michelle]], [[Marilyn Cole]], [[Lillian MÃ¼ller]], [[Shannon Tweed]], [[Brande Roderick]], [[Barbi Benton]], [[Karen Christy]], [[Sondra Theodore]], and Carrie Leighâwho filed a $35 million [[palimony]] suit against himâwere a few of his many lovers. In 1971, he acknowledged that he experimented in [[bisexuality]].{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/magazine/5020806.stm | work=BBC News | title=Faces of the week | date=May 26, 2006}} He moved from Chicago to Los Angeles. Hefner had a minor stroke in 1985 at age 59. After re-evaluating his lifestyle, he made several changes. The wild, all-night parties were toned down significantly and in 1988, daughter Christie began to run the Playboy empire. The following year, he married Playmate of the Year [[Kimberley Conrad]]. The couple had two sons, Marston Glenn (born April 9, 1990) and Cooper Bradford (born September 4, 1991).[http://www.tv.com/cooper-hefner/person/545473/summary.html TV.com], Cooper Hefner The ''E! True Hollywood Story'' profile noted that the notorious [[Playboy Mansion]] had been transformed into a family-friendly homestead. After he and Conrad separated in 1998, Conrad moved into a house next door to the mansion. Hefner then began to move an ever-changing coterie of young women into the Mansion, even dating up to seven girls at once, among them, [[Brande Roderick]], [[Izabella St. James]], [[Tina Marie Jordan]], [[Holly Madison]], [[Bridget Marquardt]], and [[Kendra Wilkinson]]. The reality television series ''[[The Girls Next Door]]'' depicted the lives of Madison, Wilkinson and Marquardt at the Playboy Mansion.[http://www.buddytv.com/articles/the-girls-next-door/a-new-boy-for-former-girl-next-26275.aspx BuddyTV.com] In October 2008, all three girls made the choice to leave the mansion. Hefner was quick to rebound and soon began dating his new "Number One" girlfriend, [[Crystal Harris]],[http://www.nydailynews.com/gossip/2009/01/06/2009-01-06_meet_playboy_founder_hugh_hefners_other_.html NYdailyNews.com], "Meet Playboy founder Hugh Hefner's other girlfriend, Crystal Harris" along with 20-year-old [[twin|identical twin]] and models [[Kristina and Karissa Shannon]].[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2008/10/17/1224351116190.html TheAge.com], Party's over for Playboy king Hugh Hefner, ''[[The Age]]'' October 18, 2008. Accessed October 30, 2008 The relationship with the twins ended in January 2010.[http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2010/feb/15/strip-scribbles-whats-next-hef-after-divorce-and-s/ Strip Scribbles: Whatâs next for Hef after divorce, Shannon twins?] After an 11-year separation, Hefner filed for divorce from Conrad stating irreconcilable differences.{{cite web| url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20303278,00.html|title= Hugh Hefner Finally Files for Divorce| work = People | accessdate=September 9, 2009}} Hefner has said that he only remained married to her for the sake of his children,{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/peopleNews/idUSTRE58874L20090909|title=Hugh Hefner files for divorce from wife|accessdate=September 9, 2009 | date=September 9, 2009|work=Reuters}} and his youngest child had just turned 18. The divorce was finalized in March 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/157359/Hefner-s-divorce-finalised-in-March |title=Hefner's divorce finalised in March |publisher=www.express.co.uk |accessdate=November 16, 2010|date= February 10, 2010 }} On December 24, 2010, Hefner presented an engagement ring to Crystal Harris, publicly announcing the proposal the following day. Hefner and Harris had planned to marry June 18, 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE6BP0EO20101226|title=Reuters: Hugh Hefner Acknowledges Engagement on Twitter|accessdate=December 26, 2010 | date=December 26, 2010}}[http://www.myprgenie.com/view-publication/hugh-hefner-gets-engaged-during-philadelphia-blizzard-on-musicmonday Hugh Hefner Gets Engaged During Philadelphia Blizzard on MusicMonday]. December 27, 2010. Harris called off the wedding just 5 days before they were due to be wed.{{cite news|url=http://uk.eonline.com/uberblog/b247178_hugh_hefners_fianceacutee_calls_off.html?cmpid=sn-000000-twitterfeed-365-topstories&utm_source=eonline&utm_medium=twitterfeed&utm_campaign=twitterfeed_topstories&dlvrit=48939|Hugh Hefner's FiancÃ©e Calls Off WeddingâJust Five Days Out!|accessdate=June 14, 2011 | date=June 14, 2011}} ==Politics and philanthropy== The [[Hugh Hefner First Amendment Award]] was created by Christie Hefner "to honor individuals who have made significant contributions in the vital effort to protect and enhance First Amendment rights for Americans."Playboy Enterprises, Inc., "[http://www.playboyenterprises.com/home/content.cfm?content=t_title_as_division&ArtTypeID=0008B752-BBD0-1C76-8FEA8304E50A010D&packet=0001F2B3-75D2-1C7A-9B578304E50A011A&MmenuFlag=foundation&viewMe=1 The Playboy Foundation â Hugh M. Hefner First Amendment Awards]". Accessed 12 July 2011. He has donated and raised money for the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]].[http://www.newsmeat.com/media_political_donations/Hugh_Hefner.php Hugh Hefner's Federal Campaign Contribution Report]. NewsMeat.com. However, he has more recently referred to himself as an Independent, due to disillusionment with both the Democratic and Republican Parties.[http://twitter.com/#!/hughhefner/status/97538784245190656] Twitter. In 1978, Hefner helped organize fund-raising efforts that led to the restoration of the [[Hollywood Sign]]. He hosted a gala fundraiser at the Playboy Mansion and personally contributed $27,000 (or 1/9 of the total restoration costs) by purchasing the letter Y in a ceremonial auction.{{cite news |url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/film/article7109871.ece |title=Hugh Hefner saves iconic Hollywood sign |publisher=[[Times Online]] |date=April 27, 2010 |accessdate=December 26, 2010 |location=London}}{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodsign.org/history-10.html |title=The History of the Sign: 1978: A Sign is Reborn |publisher=Hollywood Sign |accessdate=December 26, 2010}} Hefner donated $100,000 to the [[University of Southern California]]'s [[USC School of Cinematic Arts|School of Cinematic Arts]] to create a course called "Censorship in Cinema," and $2 million to endow a chair for the study of American film.[http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5iF4fMFSrRMvJfzXniugOlAw1MvugD8SUB2PG0 AP.Google.com], Hefner Gives $2M to USC Film School [[Associated Press]], November 16, 2007.{{Dead link|date=February 2011}} Both through his charitable foundation and individually, Hefner also contributes to charities outside the sphere of politics and publishing, throwing fundraiser events for Much Love Animal Rescue, as well as [[Generation Rescue]],{{cite web | url =http://celebrityhalo.blogspot.com/2008/10/hugh-hefner-jenny-mccarthy-fund-autism.html | title = Hugh Hefner & Jenny McCarthy Fund Autism Research | work = Celebrity Halo | month = October | year = 2008 | accessdate =December 29, 2008}} a controversial [[Autism spectrum disorder|autism]] campaign organization supported by [[Jenny McCarthy]]. On April 26, 2010, Hefner donated the last $900,000 sought by a conservation group for a land purchase needed to stop the development of the famed vista of the [[Hollywood Sign]]. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==Further reading== * Watts, Steven (2008). ''Mr. Playboy: Hugh Hefner and the American Dream''. Hoboken: John Wiley & Sons. ISBN 0-471-69059-7. * [[Russell Miller|Miller, Russell]] (1985). ''Bunny: The Real Story of Playboy''. London: Corgi. ISBN 0-03-063748-1. * St. James, Izabella (2006). ''Bunny Tales: Behind Closed Doors at the Playboy Mansion''. Philadelphia: Running Press. ISBN 0-762-42739-6 * Hefner, Veronika and Jurij Toplak (2009). Hefner, Hugh. In: Vile, John R., Hudson, David L., and Schultz, David Andrew (Eds.). Encyclopedia of the First Amendment. Washington, D.C.: CQ Press, p. 564. ==External links== {{commons|Hugh Hefner|Hugh Hefner}} *[http://www.hmhfoundation.org/ Hugh M.
